post:
Deadpool 2014 #1

deadpool June 13, 2014 @ 1:00 am, by Maarten Kossen

The long period of acquisitions and mergers of hosts that are in trouble seems to be over. Over the past two months or so, I have seen several hosts deadpool where they would have been saved by another company in the period before. So, it’s time for my first ever deadpool post!

TacticalVPS

Status: Server not found/website offline/nodes offline

TacticalVPS gained popularity quickly when they started. Ian offered some nice products and a good service. I even featured them on my first surprise post ever! But I’m afraid it wasn’t to last. At the end of May, messages began to surface about a node being offline. Shortly after, more nodes went offline. The rumor is that Ian’s wife died, though we have never heard from Ian himself. Currently, everything that was TacticalVPS seems to be unreachable and I have no faith it will be back up again soon.

LowEnd.co

Status: admitted to deadpooling/closing shop

WARNING: LowEnd.co’s website is still online and the owner was banned for suspicious activities from LowEndTalk. Please do not purchase from them, as you will most likely loose your service and not get your money back!

LowEnd.co was never featured on LowEndBox, but they were around a lot on LowEndTalk. The domain was registered in January 2014 by Michael Long and shortly after LowEnd.co opened up shop. After having some issues with another provider they were renting dedicated servers to, LowEnd put up a notice on their website claiming they deadpooled. It turned out that the owner and his business partner were very shady and have been dishonest to a lot of people. They were eventually banned for SCAM-like activities on LowEndTalk, so please use extreme caution when dealing with these people.

RaidLogic

Status: website unreachable

We have featured RaidLogic several times over the past two years. In early June, messages began to appear that they were unreachable. To this day, there has been no official announcement regarding their closure, but all seems to be offline. There is a rumor that their assets were sold to another company, but not the clients or the brand, which could explain their sudden disappearance. If anybody close to RaidLogic knows more about their closure, feel free to contact us so we may be able to enlighten this a bit more for our users.

 

BeastVM

Status: shut down

BeastVM officially closed its doors on June 5th. Due to “personal reasons & situations beyond our control” they have decided to close shop. They did refund those who purchased in the last five days leading up to the announcement. Those who still had more than 15 days of service remaining received a partial refund. Despite people getting refunds, the notice was shared on LowEndTalk first on June 8th, which leads me to conclude people weren’t given a whole lot of time to prepare to move out…

 

This concludes my first ever deadpool post. Please discuss in the comments, but keep it decent!

0shares

Maarten Kossen

Maarten Kossen was the administrator of LowEndBox from 2013 to 2015, and brought many ideas and improvements to the website during his leadership. Today he is member of our community and LowEndTalk.
